intro: Dissochaeta spectabilis, commonly known as the showy dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often covered with fine hairs. Dissochaeta spectabilis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy habitats.
